definition: low marks/low score
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Looking at the higher and lower ends of the distribution, Hyde and her colleagues again found no meaningful differences between the genders.
sentences.chinese: 而在高分端和低分端，男女的分佈也幾乎一樣。

sentences.english: Composite connections are only low-resolution, and are not ideal for HDTVs.
sentences.chinese: 複合視頻接口僅是低分辨率的，不適合高清電視。

sentences.english: At the time, only low-resolution images could be retrieved.
sentences.chinese: 在當時，只獲取到了低分辨率的圖片。

sentences.english: We have a logo but just in a low resolution format.
sentences.chinese: 我們有一個剛剛在低分辨率格式的標誌，但。

sentences.english: Marks at the lower end need to be levelled up.
sentences.chinese: 低分的一端分數需往上提。

sentences.english: Can the low-scoring brands stage a comeback?
sentences.chinese: 那麼這些低分品牌能重返榜單嗎？

sentences.english: Biased Solamnia judges gave low marks for artistic impression.
sentences.chinese: 有偏見的索蘭尼亞法官給他的形象打了低分。

sentences.english: In lower point games, the Kobold Archer shines even brighter.
sentences.chinese: 在較低分的遊戲中，狗頭人弓箭手會變得比較活躍。

sentences.english: Is there any way to compensate for the low grades you got on the exams?
sentences.chinese: 那有沒有什麼辦法彌補你的低分成績呢？

sentences.english: Secondly, the study also ascertained the significant differences of language learning beliefs on part of high- and low-achievers.
sentences.chinese: 研究查明瞭高分和低分學生語言學習觀念的顯著差異。

sentences.english: The cracks between nodes were eliminated by low-resolution edge node division.
sentences.chinese: 通過分割低分辨率節點邊的方式，消除了節點間裂縫。

sentences.english: Its prey is other low-point pieces.
sentences.chinese: 牠的獵物應該是低分的單位。

sentences.english: I don't grade down for grammar.
sentences.chinese: 但我不會因爲語法錯誤給他們低分。

sentences.english: There are probably still railway lines in low-resolution areas that I have not been able to find.
sentences.chinese: 可能還有一些低分辨率區域的鐵路線我沒找到。

sentences.english: The higher had more advantages then the latter of reading score at speed-reading strategies;
sentences.chinese: 閱讀成績高分者比低分者在快速閱讀策略上更佔優勢。

definition: high marks/high score
(exam) grade/mark/score/fraction
passing line or score (in an examination)
grade/exam mark
to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
to fail/to flunk
to grade/to give a mark
overall score/total points
horizontal line (in a fraction)/minimum passing score
(old) thanks to your lucky influence (polite reply to health inquiries)
TOEFL/Test of English as a Foreign Language
to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
Douban, PRC social networking website
cotyledon of a bean (i.e. either of the halves of a bean seed that can be split apart after removing the seed coat)/thick bean sauce (abbr. for 豆瓣醬|豆瓣酱[dou4 ban4 jiang4])
high in score but low in ability (as a result of teaching to the test)
poor evaluation/adverse criticism
negative score/minus (in grades, such as A-)
IELTS (International English Language Testing System)
